title: Chelsea already plotting £100m summer transfer spree on Moussa Dembele, Alvaro Morata and Virgil van Dijk
text:

Antonio Conte will put Celtic striker Moussa Dembele at the top of his shopping list for a £100million Chelsea summer spending spree. 
The Premier League leaders kept their powder dry in the January transfer window but will provide new boss Conte with the funds to recruit Dembele, as well as Real Madrid forward Alvaro Morata and Southampton defender Virgil van Dijk. 
Owner Roman Abramovich is impressed by the job Conte has done in his first season at Stamford Bridge, with the Blues nine points clear at the summit of the Premier League and looking certain to return to the Champions League even if they don't finish in top spot. 
And the Russian billionaire will back the former Juventus and Italy coach financially going forward. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Rio Ferdinand says Chelsea success down to Conte's training Share this video Watch Next 
The Blues' boss is a huge admirer of former Fulham starlet Dembele and is keen to sign the 20-year-old, despite being quoted £40m by Celtic during the January window. 
Dembele is aware of the interest and could be keen on the switch. There is also an understanding with Celtic that they will let him go when the time is right. 
Boss Brendan Rodgers persuaded Dembele to move to Scotland to get regular football and they only had to pay £500,000 for him last summer, so a big-money to Chelsea would represent a fantastic piece of business for the Glasgow side. Chelsea want to bring Celtic's ex-Fulham whizkid Dembele back to London (Photo: Daily Record) 
Chelsea would hope to pay less than £40m in the summer but there is a real determination to get a deal done, with Liverpool, Manchester City and Paris Saint-Germain also interested in the French youngster. 
Conte is also keen to bring in a more proven striker with Diego Costa ’s future still uncertain after his head was turned in January by a £30m-a-year offer from China. 
Chelsea have shelved plans to offer Costa a new contract and are now looking around, with Conte keen on Morata. Costa has stayed for now, but Chelsea are eyeing up long-term replacements (Photo: Getty) 
The 24-year-old Spain striker, who was also a target last summer when Costa was being pursued for a return to Atletico Madrid, understood to be open to a switch with doubts over his place at the Bernabeu. 
Dutch centre-half van Dijk is in demand, with Man City also keen, and Southampton are bracing themselves for the latest in a long line of star departures. 
Chelsea will have big money to spend if Costa does go to China, having already cashed in on midfielder Oscar with his stunning £60m switch to the Chinese Super League side Shanghai SIPG in December. Like us on Facebook
